moves.1. d4: Here I start with d4. Usually I play e4.
moves.2... dxc4: I love to play against Queen's Gambit Accepted
moves.3... Be6: Be6 protects the pawn but retards the DSB which is important for black
moves.4. a4: Computers don't suggest this move but I thought that black can play b5 then c6 keeping the material.  So to prevent this I played a4
moves.4... Nd7: Nd7 enables the knight to go to the b6 square
moves.6. Nc3 g6: Because of the LSB , black is forced to take the DSB from g7
moves.7. e4: Wastage of move but preparing for an attack
moves.9... Bxf3 10. Qxf3: I don't thing he should take the knight as it brings queen into play
moves.10... O-O 11. e5: Taking control of the board. At the same time attacking the knight and the b7 pawn
moves.12. Qxb7 e6: I don't know why but e6
moves.13. Qf3: Taking no risk with the queen, I brought it back
moves.13... Nb6: Important square for knight as said earlier
moves.14. Bd3: Many player bring their bishop to b3 but I thought to bring more attack on the king side
moves.15. O-O: And then a sacrifice d my second pawn
moves.17... cxb6 18. Re1: ??. Attacking queen by an unprotected rook
moves.19. Ne4: Bringing pieces into play with tempo
moves.20. Nf6+: If he takes with the bishop then Qxf6, Ne4, Bxe4, Qh2+, Kxh2, any move, Bh6 and mate follows
moves.20... Kh8 21. Ne4: Wanted to make room for DSB in the f6 square
moves.23. Bb7: Cutting support of the queen to the a7 pawn
moves.25... Rd7 26. Bf6 Bxf6 27. Qxf6: Trade is over and my queen is at the right spot
moves.28. Red1 Re2 29. Rde1: Wanted to trade off the rooks
moves.33. Bg4 Qc5: ??. Rook into e6 could be done by me but I missed that move
moves.35... Rc1+ 36. Kh2 Qc7+ 37. g3: Here he resinged because my next move was Rd8 . I would be a queen up . Thanks for watching.
